title: Plant pests and diseases: raspberry beetle
creator_credit: J.V. Durden, Stephen Ackroyd and Shell Film Unit
brief_description: Shows details of the life cycle of the raspberry beetle, the cause of much damage in soft-fruit crops. Shows the adult beetle feeding on unopened flower buds; mating and laying of eggs on the flower; the destruction of young berries by larvae; burrowing of larvae into plug of the fruit and consequent exposure to secondary damage by mould.
